This app permits you to hide a message in an image in order to communicate secretly.
 It is based on the spread-spectrum steganography, more specifically on the optimal version defined by Gkizeli, Pados and Medley that maximizes the signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratio.
 The image that you upload is divided in square blocks with custom side dimension (default value is 8 pixels). Each bloc carry one hidden information bit and you have to define the intensity of embedding. The steganographic process needs a signature derived from an autocorrelation matrix derived from the image itself and you can enter a custom one (the default value is for generic image).
Select the image that hide the message.
Enter the signature you want ot use.\nThe default signature is generic and suitable for all kind of natural image, but you can use a more specific one.
Choose whenever or not encode images in color
